intro: Daubenya capensis, commonly known as the African daffodil, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features strap-like, blue-green leaves that are narrow and grass-like in appearance. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Daubenya capensis is also noted for its ability to form clumps over time, adding structure to garden landscapes.
